examples: issues arising from the introduction of new technology
the introduction of muskrats into central Europe

noun.description: A formal presentation of one person to another, in which each is told the other's name.
examples: he returned to his desk, leaving Michael to make the introductions

noun.description: A thing preliminary to something else, especially an explanatory section at the beginning of a book, report, or speech.
examples: your talk will need an introduction that states clearly what you are talking about and why

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin introductio(n-), from the verb introducere (see introduce).
